SourcedStatement: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office said it had not received the letter.
Name: San Francisco mayor’s office

SourcedStatement: “We were dismayed to learn that our small, rural county was among the top three destinations in the state where people experiencing homelessness were sent by the program,”
Name: Humboldt County officials
Title: County officials

SourcedStatement: “We are concerned that providing bus tickets to other jurisdictions without verifying access to housing, family support or employment does not alleviate homelessness; it simply shifts the person to another county,”
Name: Humboldt County officials
Title: County officials

SourcedStatement: “The aim isn’t to achieve a goal. It’s to get you out of our town, and it’s cheaper than arresting you,”
Name: Paul Boden
Title: homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “Our TAP program works really well, and hopefully San Francisco can go back to more — not just dumping — but assisting and actually helping people get help,”
Name: Rex Bohn
Title: Humboldt Supervisor

SourcedStatement: Los Angeles and Sacramento counties are the two other most popular California destinations, according to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency.
Name: SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency
Justification: according to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency

SourcedStatement: Humboldt has also sent homeless people to other Bay Area locations, such as San Rafael, Napa County, Santa Cruz, and Petaluma.
Name: Humboldt’s Transportation Assistance Program, or TAP

SourcedStatement: According to the program’s website, social services staffers verify that those who use TAP will be received at their destination by a relative, friend, or appropriate agency.
Name: Humboldt’s Transportation Assistance Program, or TAP
